intro: Scleranthus microdus, commonly known as the small-fruited thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and has a distinctive appearance with small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Scleranthus microdus is an annual plant that produces small, dry fruits that disperse its seeds through the wind.
